item.title: London calling
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Monday we returned home from 10 days in the UK.  We stayed with my Great Aunt Bernie and Great Uncle Jim at their lovely house in Kent, Treetop.  Both kids loved exploring the place, and Maggie enjoyed being able to have private art lessons courtesy of Jim.  I have many fond memories of visiting Treetop as a child, and hope Maggie and Graeme will too! We were able to do some day trips, despite a variety of illnesses that struck down each one of us at some stage! While traveling with kids definitely had it’s struggles (note: the enclosed capsules of the London Eye are not ideal for a screaming 14 month old….), I think we all enjoyed being in England, and I’m sure to be fielding many questions for when we’ll be returning – especially as Maggie has already asked about when we’ll see baby Alexa again!

And we’re off!

London
We took the train up to the city twice, the first time to visit with Rachel and her family, and Gemma and her family, and the second time to tick off items on Maggie’s bucket list: ride the top of a double decker bus, see Big Ben, go on the London Eye, and see Peter Pan.

                   

Hever Castle
Maggie also wanted to “see a real Queen’s castle”.

    

Rochester
First photo was taken by Maggie – nice to have a budding photographer in the family!

       

Kew Gardens
Not many photos – but beautiful park with a treetop walkway the kids loved and a fantastic playground.

Treetop
The real highlight of the trip was the time spent with family – the kids meeting their great, great aunt and uncle, us getting to meet baby Lexie, and lots of time spent just catching up!

item.title: A very colorful 4th birthday
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: Today we celebrated Maggie’s 4th birthday with LOTS of rainbows!  Thankfully, despite a forecast all week of rain, it held off and we were able to enjoy an evening of fun, friends, and cake!

item.title: End of Pre-K…
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Maggie had her end of year performance at St. Col’s – warning: cuteness overload! Enjoy!

With a little help from my friends

Inch by Inch

item.title: Another holiday season in the books
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We celebrated Graeme’s 1st and Maggie’s 4th Christmas with no shortage of candy canes, caroling, and cheer! Maggie was really into Christmas this year and it made everything all the more exciting – from writing her list, to shopping for her brother and daddy, to posing for the holiday card photo, she did it all with a smile on her face and a skip in her step.  We got to meet Santa, see the Nutcracker her dance school put on, decorate gingerbread houses, and see lots of family and friends – while it’s always sad when the holidays are over, ours were so jam-packed that I’m looking forward to a quiet January!

item.title: Halloween 2016
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We found lots of opportunities to dress up this Halloween season – Boo at the Stone Zoo with the Fourniers, Trunk or Treat at St. Col’s with cousins, and Trick or Treating with the Morgans.

item.title: Goodbye, Summer
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Summer of 2016 went by way too quickly! Being on maternity leave meant we were able to take advantage of a few more trips away and lots of mid-week playdates with friends – it was a great summer and while I’m glad for the cooler weather, not as excited to have to get back to real life!

Some summer highlights:

Graeme arrived…

Maggie turned 3…

We had an overnight in York, ME with the McArdles…

went to Plymouth with some Healeys…

  

spent a week in Brewster…

 

 

celebrated as Janelle and Jared tied the knot…

 

got in some cousin time…

and lots of fun with friends!

      

 

This was definitely a summer to remember, I’m sad to see it go!

item.title: Three?!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Maggie celebrated her third birthday this week – sadly, she was sick for her actual birthday, but we were able to squeeze in some fun prior to that day to offset.

In the past year, Maggie has developed quite the personality.  She is extremely strong willed (I’m sure we’ll appreciate that when she’s an adult and entering the workforce!), but also goofy, loving, and sensitive.  She can be the sweetest kid when she wants to be, but also gives us a good run for our money.  Her truest colors have shown through with the addition of Graeme to the family – she is quite the caretaker and showers him with love and kisses as much as we allow her!

Highlights from the past year:

- Started dance class and performed in her first recital
- Attended her first wedding
- First performance of the Nutcracker
- Moved to a big girl bed
- Potty trained
- First time bowling (we went for Mommy’s birthday)
- 2 more flights added to her count – to DC and Miami – bringing her total to 7 round trips so far! Not bad for a 3 year old.

We once again celebrated her birthday with the Harringtons/Healeys over the July 4th weekend, and then this past weekend she and Aoife had a joint Fairy themed party with their friends.  The rain tried to ruin our plans, but despite having to move the party indoors, lots of fun was had!

item.title: Graeme’s Newborn Shoot
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We had Lyndsay over in early July to capture some photos of our new expanded family – I absolutely love how they came out!  Maggie is so in love with Graeme and you can really see it in these photos, I love watching her interact with him and her gentle touch makes me love her even more than I thought possible! I know this phase won’t last forever – talk to me when he is big enough to start getting into her stuff – but I’ll relish it while it’s here!

Here are some favorites:

item.title: Graeme has arrived!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
So it all started 10 days earlier…I spent a night barely sleeping as my whole body was itchier than I had ever experienced.  I put a call in to the doctor who recommended going in for some blood work, hmmm. Monday’s blood work followed with an appointment Tuesday with my dr.  At this point, we weren’t sure what was going on, but there was a chance of an issue called obstetric cholestasis and so began the week of stress.  We went back and forth with whether or not there was a need to induce, had more blood work and ultrasounds every other day, all while waiting on ONE test to come back that can take 5-7 days (why any blood test takes that long, I have no idea!).  Finally came the morning of Maggie’s recital and the day we were due to find out for sure, yes or no on an induction.  A morning call from my doctor said, we’re in the clear – we’ll wait for you to go into labor naturally.  So off we went to Maggie’s recital relieved that everything was okay.  At intermission, I check my phone and have a voicemail from my doctor “nothing urgent, but call me when you can” – turns out after a day of discussing my case with some other physicians and diving closely into my blood work, they decided I was, in fact, a candidate for an induction and…could I come in tonight?

We drove Maggie home, put her to bed, packed up the car and headed for the hospital, leaving Maggie with Nana.  At this point, they were happy to induce and see if my body would go into labor itself – after a C-section with Maggie, I was more than happy to try and avoid that scenario again.

We started the induction and settled in for a long night/few days….after about 12 hours, we decided the induction wouldn’t work, Graeme wasn’t responding well to the contractions and they didn’t want to push it, and so a repeat c-section was planned and by 1:31pm on June 13, we welcomed our baby boy!

Introducing Graeme Robert Harrington, weighing 6lbs 11oz and measuring 19 inches, and as scrumptious as they come!

item.title: Our Tiny Dancer
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
After attending weekly Saturday morning dance classes since last fall, Maggie’s first recital was finally here.  I was nervous as to how she would do – we had talked about going on stage and dancing with her friends, but I was pretty sure she had no idea what that actually entailed.  Rehearsal happened the day before and despite a little trepidation at first, she went out on stage and performed both her dances wonderfully!  Sunday’s performance included a costume change and having Daddy, Nana, Grandma, and Papa in the audience as well – and once again, she did great!  Enjoy below!

Tap routine

Ballet (this once was a little shakier…though they only spent about 10 minutes at the end of each class on ballet, and the distractions on stage are pretty entertaining!)

Despite a week of being unsure as to whether or not we (specifically I) would be able to even make the recital (see Graeme has arrived!) – I was so proud and excited to be able to cheer on our little girl who doesn’t seem so little these days!
